Session 1A. Infrastructure and Technologies

    Venue: Victoria Falls Convention Centre
    Chair: Charles Greenberg

  • Landscape of Open Access Repositories with Special Reference to Electronic Theses and Dissertations (ETD) across SAARC and BRICS Nations: A Comparative Analysis
  • Designing a plan for sharing ETD among the University Libraries in Bangladesh
  • Implementing Persistent Identifier Infrastructure for Effective Management of ETD Repositories: A Case Study from Chartered Institute of Personnel Management, Sri Lanka

    Venue: Victoria Falls Convention Centre
    Chair: Gabriela Mejias

  • Future-Proofing Research by Long-term ETD Preservation: Challenges and Opportunities
  • E-Theses and Dissertations in Zambia: A Case Study of Two Universities in Kabwe
  • Nurturing Advanced Research Culture among Medical Practitioners through ETDs: A case study from University of Kelaniya, Sri Lanka

  • Lunch

Session 2A. Impact and Utilisation

    Venue: Victoria Falls Convention Centre
    Chair: Olatunbosun Obileye

  • Characterization of Scientific Production on Electronic Theses and Dissertations Based on a Bibliometric Analysis

    Venue: Victoria Falls Convention Centre
    Chair: Hussein Suleman

  • Empowering HRM Professionals: Advancing Research Culture with ETDs in The Chartered Institute of Personnel Management (CIPM), Sri Lanka

      Venue: Victoria Falls Convention Centre
      Chair: Lombe Tembo

    • Enhancing Electronic Thesis and Dissertation Visibility: A Focus on Institutional Repository Platforms and Inherent Challenges in the Nigerian Context | David, Okhakhu O., Sophia Adeyeye

    • Automatic Summarisation of Electronic Theses and Dissertations for Increased Media Engagement | Martin C. Musonda, Lighton Phiri
    • Automatic Electronic Thesis and Dissertation Guideline Verification For Consistently Formatted Manuscripts | Mubanga C. Chibesa, Albertina Mooka, Gift Mawele, Lwiime Shansonga, Lighton Phiri
    • Design and Implementation of an Interoperable Zambia National Electronic Thesis and Dissertation Portal | Elijah Chileshe, Lighton Phiri
    • Exploring AI-driven strategies for enhancing the visibility of E-Theses in Shodhganga Repository | Nabajitm Saikia, Vivek Mr. Ranjan, Kumar K Manoj, Surbhi
    • Assessing the Efficiency of Data Science Programs in Enhancing Big Data Analysis Skills among Health Libraries and Information Scientists | Rajabu Simba
    • Optimizing Electronic Theses and Dissertations Management for Broad Audience Engagement at Dr. Magufuli Library of Mbeya University of Science and Technology, Tanzania | Zainabu H. Lilutu
    • Determining the factors influencing the utilization of open source digital repository software in the preservation of ETDs in academic libraries in Bangladesh | Zillur Rahman
    • ETDs in Ensuring Quality Education for Economic Growth to Achieve Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs): Experience of SAARC Countries | Zillur Rahman
    • The University of Johannesburg’s journey to enhance the content of the Institutional Repository (IR) and improve discoverability | Mutali Lithole
    • The conversion of printed theses and dissertations into digital formats: A case study of the University of South Africa library | Mduduzi Ntetha
    • Global Visibility of National ETD Repositories of G20 Countries: comparative studies with respect to NDLTD's meta repository | Sukanta Kumar Patra
    • Managing ETDs in Rajshahi University Central Library : Problems and Possibilities | M.A.M. Mominur Rahman
    • Creating an ETD database using OMEKA. The Zimbabwe Open University Experience | Kandira Nobbie
